alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Amherst; Bath; Bedford; Botetourt; Rockbridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 13 at 4:01AM EST until February 13 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts. * WHERE...Portions of west central and southwest Virginia. Virginia. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 4 PM EST today. * IMPACTS...Untreated roads and sidewalks will become slippery and hazardous. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Untreated and secondary roads will become snow covered and hazardous this morning as temperatures fall into the 20s. Any remaining moisture or slush will refreeze Monday morning as temperatures fall into the teens and lower 20s. Some black ice will be possible Monday morning as well. In addition, wind chill readings will range from around -5 in western Greenbrier County to +5 in eastern Greenbrier County early Monday.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities...and use caution while driving. Please report snow, sleet or ice accumulations via email at rnk.skywarn@noaa.gov or by calling the National Weather Service toll free at...1...866...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Leave a message with your observation and the specific location where it occurred. You can also post your report to National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
